DataElement.preferredName: Pleural Effusion Ascites Pericardial Effusion Personal Medical History Eligibility Determination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no indicator that describes whether or not a patient has pleural effusion, ascites, or pericardial effusion as part of their medical history.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pleural Effusion Ascites Pericardial Effusion Personal Medical History Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Increased amounts of fluid within the pleural cavity. Symptoms include shortness of breath, cough, and chest pain. It is usually caused by lung infections, congestive heart failure, pleural and lung tumors, connective tissue disorders, and trauma._The accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, which may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum._Fluid collection within the pericardial sac, usually due to inflammation._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Pleural Effusion Ascites Pericardial Effusion Personal Medical History
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Increased amounts of fluid within the pleural cavity. Symptoms include shortness of breath, cough, and chest pain. It is usually caused by lung infections, congestive heart failure, pleural and lung tumors, connective tissue disorders, and trauma.:The accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, which may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum.:Fluid collection within the pericardial sac, usually due to inflammation.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Concepts.definition: Increased amounts of fluid within the pleural cavity. Symptoms include shortness of breath, cough, and chest pain. It is usually caused by lung infections, congestive heart failure, pleural and lung tumors, connective tissue disorders, and trauma.
The accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, which may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum.
Fluid collection within the pericardial sac, usually due to inflammation.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Property.preferredDefinition: Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a pleural effusion, ascites or pericardial effusion that requires drainage, peritoneal shunt, or Cell-free and Concentrated Ascites Reinfusion Therapy (CART)?
